item.title: Stacks in go and python
item.description: Using list as a stack Stacks come very handy in solving some of the problems. Often using just an array does the purpose rather than specific data structures. In python to use a list as a stack is straight forward with append and pop methods already available. if __name__ == '__main__': st = [] for i in range(10): st.append(i) for i in range(10): top = st.pop() print(top) In go to use slices as a stack, push and pop methods are missing.

item.title: Partitioning an Array
item.description: Paritioning an array is a common problem in computer science. In quick sort, the array is partitioned into smaller/equal and larger values based on the pivot. There are many other partition problems partition function is different than the one in quick sort. Here adding a generic code template to solve such partition problems in O(n) time and O(1) space (or without using extra space). 2 way partition problem Examples: Partition the array such that all the even numbers come before all the odd numbers.
